articles.headline: Selecting a Seatmate to Make Skies Friendlier
articles.snippet: The Dutch carrier KLM and others are testing programs to allow ticket-holders to upload details from their online profiles and use that data to choose seatmates.
articles.abstract: The Dutch carrier KLM and others are testing programs to allow ticket-holders to upload details from their online profiles and use that data to choose seatmates.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS — On his eight-hour flight to New York from Switzerland last month, Jeff Jarvis, a well-known blogger and journalism professor, found himself seated next to a woman eager to discuss the finer points of management theory.

articles.headline: A Fraud Went Undetected, Although Easy to Spot
articles.snippet: Fraud involving a Chinese company traded in the United States was basically spelled out in documents that were publicly available in China, but it appears no one bothered to look.
articles.abstract: Fraud involving a Chinese company traded in the United States was basically spelled out in documents that were publicly available in China, but it appears no one bothered to look.
articles.lead_paragraph: Without a rule of law, investing is an extraordinarily hazardous undertaking.

articles.headline: J.&J.’s Next Chief Is Steeped in Sales Culture
articles.snippet: Like the man he will succeed as chief, Alex Gorsky is a company insider who served at Johnson & Johnson during one of the most tumultuous periods in its history
articles.abstract: Like the man he will succeed as chief, Alex Gorsky is a company insider who served at Johnson & Johnson during one of the most tumultuous periods in its history
articles.lead_paragraph: Alex Gorsky, the newly named chief executive of Johnson & Johnson, shares a crucial biographical detail with William C. Weldon, the man he is succeeding. Both got their starts as pharmaceutical sales representatives, a notoriously grueling job that — because it demands stamina, charisma and a near devotion to making the sale — has become a crucible for future drug company executives in recent years.

articles.headline: Bribery Case Falls Apart, and Tactics Are Doubted
articles.snippet: A sting that ensnarled 22 executives in a foreign bribery case fell apart, calling into question the Justice Department’s increasingly aggressive tactics in enforcing a corruption law.
articles.abstract: A sting that ensnarled 22 executives in a foreign bribery case fell apart, calling into question the Justice Department’s increasingly aggressive tactics in enforcing a corruption law.
articles.lead_paragraph: The case seemed tailor-made for a movie: 22 business executives were arrested in an undercover sting in which F.B.I. agents posed as greedy bribe-taking officials seeking to arm their tiny African nation with grenade launchers and other military hardware.

articles.headline: Resolute Putin Faces a Russia That’s Changed
articles.snippet: Prime Minister Vladimir V. Putin, likely to be elected president next month, will face a Russian society that has greatly changed under his watch, while he has remained essentially the same.
articles.abstract: Prime Minister Vladimir V. Putin, likely to be elected president next month, will face a Russian society that has greatly changed under his watch, while he has remained essentially the same.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — A guest hovering around the doorway of an elegant restaurant last fall glimpsed a ritual worthy of a czar.

articles.headline: After a Year, Deep Divisions Hobble Syria’s Opposition
articles.snippet: Nearly a year into Syria’s uprising, the opposition to President Bashar al-Assad is a fractious collection of divided political groups, longtime exiles, grass-roots organizers and militants.
articles.abstract: Nearly a year into Syria’s uprising, the opposition to President Bashar al-Assad is a fractious collection of divided political groups, longtime exiles, grass-roots organizers and militants.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — Syria’s downward spiral into more hellish conflict in cities like Homs has provoked a new surge of outrage around the world, with Arab and many Western countries searching for new ways to support protesters and activist groups coming under the government’s increasingly lethal assault.

articles.headline: Bank of America Breaks With Fannie Mae
articles.snippet: The bank’s move represents a major escalation in a protracted legal battle over how many defaulted mortgages Bank of America will have to buy back from Fannie.
articles.abstract: The bank’s move represents a major escalation in a protracted legal battle over how many defaulted mortgages Bank of America will have to buy back from Fannie.
articles.lead_paragraph: Bank of America said Thursday that it would no longer sell new mortgages to Fannie Mae, underscoring tensions in a fight between giants of the home loan market over billions in losses in the housing bubble.

articles.headline: G.O.P. Fund-Raiser Faces Inquiries Into His Races
articles.snippet: Questions surrounding Representative Vern Buchanan’s Florida campaigns are threatening to distract from the Republicans’ national finance operation.
articles.abstract: Questions surrounding Representative Vern Buchanan’s Florida campaigns are threatening to distract from the Republicans’ national finance operation.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Last year, House Republican leaders tapped an up-and-coming Florida lawmaker, Representative Vern Buchanan, to lead the party’s fund-raising for candidates nationwide, a crucial part of their efforts to keep control of the House in November.

articles.headline: Trying to Find a Cry of Desperation Amid the Facebook Drama
articles.snippet: Mental health experts say that dark postings by adolescents should not be hastily dismissed because they can serve as an early warning system for timely intervention.
articles.abstract: Mental health experts say that dark postings by adolescents should not be hastily dismissed because they can serve as an early warning system for timely intervention.
articles.lead_paragraph: For adolescents, Facebook and other social media have created an irresistible forum for online sharing and oversharing, so much so that endless mood-of-the-moment updates have inspired a snickering retort on T-shirts and posters: “Face your problems, don’t Facebook them.”

articles.headline: Political Lessons, From a Mother’s Losing Run
articles.snippet: Mitt Romney often refers to his father, George Romney, in his campaign, but he also learned much from his mother, Lenore, who ran for a United States Senate seat.
articles.abstract: Mitt Romney often refers to his father, George Romney, in his campaign, but he also learned much from his mother, Lenore, who ran for a United States Senate seat.
articles.lead_paragraph: BLOOMFIELD HILLS, Mich. — Mitt Romney was 22 when his father came to him and his siblings in search of political advice in December 1969. George Romney, the former Michigan governor, was mulling the electoral prospects of another Romney: his wife, Lenore.

articles.headline: Money Fund in Japan Told to Halt Operations
articles.snippet: The move comes after public investigators discovered that AIJ Investment Advisors may have lost the bulk of about $2.3 billion in funds it managed for its clients.
articles.abstract: The move comes after public investigators discovered that AIJ Investment Advisors may have lost the bulk of about $2.3 billion in funds it managed for its clients.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — Japanese financial authorities suspended the operations of a money management firm on Friday after it was unable to account for the bulk of $2.6 billion in pension funds it managed for its clients.

articles.headline: Nations Press Halt in Attacks to Allow Aid to Syrian Cities
articles.snippet: Even as international leaders called for a pause in Syria’s assault on rebellious cities, their meeting in Tunisia underscored deepening divisions over how to end the crackdown.
articles.abstract: Even as international leaders called for a pause in Syria’s assault on rebellious cities, their meeting in Tunisia underscored deepening divisions over how to end the crackdown.
articles.lead_paragraph: TUNIS — Representatives of more than 60 nations and organizations called on Syria’s government on Friday to halt its attacks on besieged cities and asked the United Nations to begin planning for a peacekeeping force, even as prospects for a diplomatic way out of the conflict appeared dim.

articles.headline: S.&P. 500 at Highest Close Since ’08
articles.snippet: Investors have moved past psychological barriers of late, but analysts say the economy is still not back to full strength.
articles.abstract: Investors have moved past psychological barriers of late, but analysts say the economy is still not back to full strength.
articles.lead_paragraph: As summer approached in 2008, oil prices were surging, the housing market was collapsing and banks were bleeding money. Soon, Lehman Brothers would collapse and shock the financial system, sending stocks plunging. Investors dug out of that hole this week.
